metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7791 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: On pages containing an iframe, the "data:" protocol can be used to create a modal alert that will render over arbitrary domains following page navigation, spoofing of the origin of the modal alert from the iframe content. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.3, Firefox ESR < 52.3, and Firefox < 55.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
